Description: Bead of square section. The bead is in opaque dark-blue glass with cylindrical vertical piercing. Impressed on each face a continuous undulating serpent in opaque yellow, white, brown, and orange. At upper and lower edge of each face a monochrome orange border was impressed quite unskilfully. These borders were applied first as in several places the serpents overlap them. Poor work. The surface is extensively chipped.
Curator's comments: Cf. 1891,0509.38 and 1939,0322.45 Sale Catalogue, Henry Salt Collection, Sotheby, London, 28 June – 8 July 1835, lot 619.
